description: Master the classic sliding block puzzle to guide the main red block to freedom.
rationale: This game focuses on spatial reasoning and pathfinding. It is ideal for training AI agents in long-term planning and state-space search algorithms, as every move counts towards an optimal solution.
details: The game consists of a 4x5 grid containing various rectangular blocks. One 2x2 block (the King block) must be moved to the bottom-center exit. Other blocks of sizes 1x1, 1x2, and 2x1 act as obstacles. Blocks can only slide into adjacent empty spaces. The game state is represented as a 2D array, and the challenge lies in the limited maneuvering space.

game_rules.win_condition: 2x2 block reaches coordinates (1, 3) at the bottom exit
game_rules.move_limit: None, but lower moves yield higher efficiency ratings
game_rules.collision: Blocks cannot overlap or move outside the 4x5 boundary

how_to_stop: kill $(pgrep -f 'uv run main.py') or press ESC in the game window
how_to_play: Click and drag blocks using the mouse or use arrow keys to move the selected block. Each successful move increases the move counter. The score is calculated as 10000 / total_moves upon reaching the exit. Lower moves result in a higher final score.
observation_space: 4x5 integer matrix representing block IDs and positions
action_space: Select block (0-9) and Direction (Up, Down, Left, Right)
